Its capital is Bologna, which is known for having one of Italy's highest quality of life indices and advanced social services. Emilia-Romagna is also a center for food and automobile production, with popular coastal resorts like Cervia, Cesenatico, Rimini, and Riccione. It is one of the wealthiest and most developed regions in Europe, with the third highest GDP per capita in Italy.
